metadata.title: CVE-2022-1184 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in fs/ext4/namei.c:dx_insert_block() in theLinux kernelâ€™s filesystem sub-component. This flaw allows a local attackerwith a user privilege to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-156-generic - 5.4.0-156.173
linux-image-5.4.0-156-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-156.173
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-156-generic - 5.4.0-156.173
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-156-lowlatency - 5.4.0-156.173
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1096-kvm - 5.4.0-1096.102
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-156.173').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11').
